item.title: Gabriel add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "There is in nature a parallel unity which corresponds to the unity in the mind and makes it available. This methodizing mind meets no resistance in its attempts. The scattered blocks, with which it strives to form a symmetrical structure, fit. This design following after finds with joy that like design went before. Not only man puts things in a row, but things belong in a row." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Gabriel add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Besides, rereading, not reading, is what counts." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Gabriel add a quote by Eugene Ionesco
item.description: "A work of art really is above all an adventure of the mind." -- Eugene Ionesco
